Incident.Summary: Members of the Firearms Enforcement Unit were provided pertinent information from the Maryland State Police Disapproval Unit pertaining to a prohibited subject, Carlos Winston MOSELEY (B/M DOB: 9/22/1959), in possession of regulated firearm.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: NARRATIVE: During the month of July, members of the Firearms Enforcement Unit were assigned a Handgun Qualification License (HQL -2023-06328) Disapproval investigation in reference to Carlos Winston MOSELEY (Black/Male DOB: 9/22/1959). On the date of 3/19/1982, MOSELEY plead guilty and was convicted for Battery in Prince George County, Maryland District Court (Case number: 000000767078).MOSELEY was queried through the Department of Natural Resources (DNR) database through the Maryland Automated Firearms Services System (MAFSS) database with a positive result of a regulated firearm: Make: Ruger Model: SP101DA Caliber: 357 Serial Number: 57219132. On July 12, 2023, investigators contacted MOSELEY via telephone (301)-440-2868, which he answered. FEU members identified themselves and explained the nature of the call. MOSELEY acknowledged and made arrangements with investigations to conduct a Knock-and-Talk at his residence. On July 14, 2023, at approximately 0915 hours, members of FEU and SOG-E (Strategic Operation Group East) contacted MOSELEY at his residence at 1702 Shea Lane, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland, Maryland. Investigators provided MOSELEY a Consent to Search and Seizure Form (MSP 78), which he was cooperative with investigators, signed, and granted investigators permission to search his residence. MOSELEY advised investigators that the handgun was located in his master bedroom dresser drawer. The following firearm was verified and seized: Make: Ruger Model: SP101DA Caliber: 357 Serial Number: 57219132 MOSELEY was providedcopies of the Consent to Search and Seize and was explained the expungement process. Investigators transferred the firearm to a Federal Firearm License (FFL) Tom Rothermund of TRL Firearms Gunsmithing located at 106 East Isabella Street, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland. Rothermund signed and provided a copy of MSP Form 67 (Chain of Custody). Investigators contacted the Assistant States Attorney Michael Calabrese of the Wicomico County. The facts and findings of the case were presented and discussed with SA Calabrese were it was determined that the Wicomico County States Attorneys Office would decline prosecution of MOSELEY. All the above events occurred in Wicomico County, Maryland. Case closed.
